title: The Undy 500
text:
ABC Open South West Victoria We race in our undies 
Once a year on the Victorian coast, just after the tourists have packed up their tents and scraped off their surfboard wax, the townsfolk come out to run down the main street in their underwear. 
The race is called the Undy 500. 
No one seems to know how it started or why it exists, but we don't mind. It's ridiculous enough to not matter. 
The competitors line up, shivering in the cold and wind of a summer's day in Warrnambool at 8am. 
Many of them are traditionally not competitive runners, with some charging up on a bacon and egg breakfast moments before racing. 
The Undy 500 and associated big breakfast is held at the centre of town, on Leibig Street, the main street. 
It launches the Wunta Fiesta which is about celebrating everything local in Warrnambool â€” including the locals themselves, and their underwear. 
Thanks to ABC Open contributors Rhonda McDonnell and Rosana Sialong who filmed most of the action shots in this film and also, thanks to backup photographers Karen O'Brien and Carol Jenkins. Published 03 Feb 2017. Warrnambool VIC 3280 Share
